name: Team Collaboration and Project Sharing
description: As a developer working with a team
I want to share VDE configurations with my team
So that everyone has consistent development environments

elements.name: New team member sets up VDE for first time

steps.name: I am a new developer joining the team
I have cloned the project repository
the project contains VDE configuration in configs/
I run the initial setup
VDE should detect my operating system
appropriate base images should be built
my SSH keys should be automatically configured
I should see available VMs with "list-vms"

elements.name: Share project VM configuration via git

steps.name: my project has a "python" VM configuration
the docker-compose.yml is committed to the repo
a teammate clones the repository
they run "create-virtual-for python"
they should get the same Python environment I have
all dependencies should be installed
project directories should be properly mounted

elements.name: Sync team member's SSH config changes

steps.name: the team has updated SSH config templates
I pull the latest changes
I create or restart any VM
my SSH config should be updated with new entries
my existing SSH entries should be preserved
I should not lose my personal SSH configurations
the team uses PostgreSQL for development
postgres VM configuration is in the repository
each team member starts "postgres" VM
each developer gets their own isolated PostgreSQL instance
data persists in each developer's local data/postgres/
developers don't interfere with each other's databases
our production uses PostgreSQL 14, Redis 7, and Node 18
I configure VDE with matching versions
my local development should match production
version-specific bugs can be caught early
deployment surprises are minimized

elements.name: Onboard new developer with pre-built VMs

steps.name: the team maintains a set of pre-configured VMs
documentation explains how to create each VM
a new developer joins
they follow the setup instructions
they should have all VMs running in minutes
they can start contributing immediately

elements.name: Team agrees on standard VM types

steps.name: the team defines standard VM types in vm-types.conf
new projects need specific language support
the VM type is already defined
anyone can create the VM using the standard name
everyone gets consistent configurations
aliases work predictably across the team
a project requires specific services (postgres, redis, nginx)
the project README documents required VMs
developers run the documented create commands
all developers have compatible environments
"docker-compose up" works for everyone
local development matches the documented setup
a project needs environment variables for configuration
env-files/project-name.env is committed to git (with defaults)
a developer creates and starts the VM
environment variables should be loaded from env-file
developers can override variables in local env-file (gitignored)
sensitive variables stay out of version control
a developer cannot reproduce a bug
another developer shares their exact VM configuration
the first developer recreates the VM
both developers have identical environments
the bug becomes reproducible
debugging becomes more effective

elements.name: Team expands VDE with new language support

steps.name: the team decides to add "dart" support
one developer runs "add-vm-type dart 'apt-get install -y dart'"
commits the vm-types.conf change
all developers can create dart VMs
everyone has access to the same dart environment
the team's language support grows consistently

name: Configuration Management
description: As a developer
I want to configure VDE to match my project needs
So that my development environment matches my requirements

elements.name: Configure VM with custom install command

steps.name: I need specific packages in my Python VM
I add a VM type with custom install command
"apt-get install -y python3 python3-pip my-package" should run
my custom packages should be available in the VM

elements.name: Add service VM with custom port

steps.name: I need a MySQL service on port 3306
I run "add-vm-type --type service --svc-port 3306 mysql 'apt-get install -y mysql-server'"
mysql VM should be created
port 3306 should be mapped to host
I can connect to MySQL from other VMs

elements.name: Configure VM with multiple service ports

steps.name: I need a service that exposes multiple ports
the VM type configuration includes multiple ports
all ports should be mapped in docker-compose.yml
each port should be accessible from host
each port should be accessible from other VMs
I want friendly names in listings
I add VM type with --display "Go Language"
"Go Language" should appear in list-vms output
the display name should be used in all user-facing messages
I want to reference VMs with short names
I add VM type with aliases "js,node,nodejs"
I can use any alias to reference the VM
"start-virtual js", "start-virtual node", "start-virtual nodejs" all work
aliases should show in list-vms output
I need different port ranges for my environment
I modify VDE_LANG_PORT_START and VDE_LANG_PORT_END
new VMs should use ports in my custom range
existing VMs keep their allocated ports
I need a different base OS or variant
I modify base-dev.Dockerfile
I rebuild VMs with --rebuild
VMs should use my custom base image
my OS-specific requirements should be met
my application needs specific environment variables
I create env-files/myapp.env
I add variables like NODE_ENV=development
variables should be available in the VM
variables are loaded automatically when VM starts

elements.name: Configure custom UID/GID for container user

steps.name: my host user has different UID/GID than 1000
I modify the UID and GID in docker-compose.yml
container user should match my host user
file permissions should work correctly
I won't have permission issues on shared volumes
I need to mount specific directories into the VM
I modify the volumes section in docker-compose.yml
my custom directories should be mounted
files should be shared between host and VM
changes should sync immediately
I want to limit VM memory usage
I add mem_limit to docker-compose.yml
container should be limited to specified memory
container should not exceed the limit
my system stays responsive
I need custom DNS for my VMs
I modify DNS settings in docker-compose.yml
VMs should use my DNS servers
name resolution should work as configured
I need some VMs on isolated networks
I create custom networks in docker-compose.yml
VMs can be isolated as needed
specific VMs can communicate
other VMs cannot reach isolated VMs
I want to control VM logging
I modify logging configuration in docker-compose.yml
logs can go to files, syslog, or stdout
log rotation can be configured
I can control log verbosity
I want VMs to restart automatically
I set restart: always in docker-compose.yml
VM restarts if it crashes
VM starts on system boot (if Docker does)
my environment recovers automatically
I want to know if VM is healthy
I add healthcheck to docker-compose.yml
Docker monitors VM health
I can see health status in docker ps
unhealthy VMs can be restarted automatically
I want team to use same VM configuration
I commit docker-compose.yml and env-files to git
team members get identical configuration
environment is consistent across team
"works on my machine" is reduced
I need local configuration different from team
I create .env.local or docker-compose.override.yml
I add it to .gitignore
my local overrides are not committed
team configuration is not affected
I can customize for my environment

elements.name: Configure multiple instances of same VM type

steps.name: I need two different Python environments
I create "python-dev" and "python-test" VMs
both should use python base configuration
each should have separate data directory
each can run independently
I've modified VM configuration
I run validation or try to start VM
syntax errors should be caught
invalid ports should be rejected
missing required fields should be reported
VDE configuration format has changed
I pull the latest VDE
old configurations should still work
migration should happen automatically
I should be told about manual steps if needed
I've made configuration changes I want to undo
I remove my custom configurations
I reload VM types
default configurations should be used
my VMs work with standard settings
my VM won't start due to configuration
I check docker-compose config
I should see the effective configuration
errors should be clearly indicated
I can identify the problematic setting

name: Daily Development Workflow
description: As a developer using VDE
I want to manage my development containers efficiently
So I can focus on coding without managing infrastructure

steps.name: I have VDE installed
I request to start my Python development environment
the Python VM should be started
SSH access should be available on the configured port
my workspace directory should be mounted
I have several VMs running
I ask "what's running?"
I should see a list of all running VMs
each VM should show its status
the list should include both language and service VMs

elements.name: Getting connection information for a VM

steps.name: I have a Python VM running
I ask "how do I connect to Python?"
I should receive SSH connection details
the details should include the hostname
the details should include the port number
the details should include the username
I have multiple VMs running
I request to "stop everything"
all running VMs should be stopped
no containers should be left running
the operation should complete without errors
I have a Python VM running
I request to "restart python with rebuild"
the Python VM should be stopped
the container should be rebuilt from the Dockerfile
the Python VM should be started again
my workspace should still be mounted
I need a full stack environment
I request to "start python and postgres"
both Python and PostgreSQL VMs should start
they should be on the same Docker network
they should be able to communicate

elements.name: Creating a new VM for the first time

steps.name: I want to try a new language
I request to "create a Go VM"
the Go VM configuration should be created
the Docker image should be built
SSH keys should be configured
the VM should be ready to start

name: Daily Development Workflow
description: As a developer
I want to manage multiple development environments seamlessly
So that I can switch between projects and languages efficiently

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I previously created VMs for "python", "rust", and "postgres"
I run "start-virtual python rust postgres"
all three VMs should be running
I should be able to SSH to "python-dev" on allocated port
I should be able to SSH to "rust-dev" on allocated port
PostgreSQL should be accessible from language VMs

elements.name: Create a new language VM for a project

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I need to start a "golang" project
I don't have a "go" VM yet
I run "create-virtual-for go"
a go development environment should be created
docker-compose.yml should be configured for go
SSH config entry for "go-dev" should be added
projects/go directory should be created
I can start the VM with "start-virtual go"

elements.name: Switch from Python to Rust project

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I have "python" VM running
I have "rust" VM created but not running
I want to work on a Rust project instead
I run "start-virtual rust"
both "python" and "rust" VMs should be running
I can SSH to both VMs from my terminal
each VM has isolated project directories

elements.name: Connect to PostgreSQL from Python VM

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
"postgres" VM is running
"python" VM is running
I SSH into "python-dev"
I run "psql -h postgres -U devuser"
I should be connected to PostgreSQL
I can query the database
the connection uses the container network

elements.name: Shut down all VMs at end of day

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
multiple VMs are running
I run "shutdown-virtual all"
all VMs should be stopped
VM configurations should remain for next session
docker ps should show no VDE containers running

elements.name: Run multiple language VMs for a polyglot project

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I have a project using Python, JavaScript, and Redis
I run "start-virtual python js redis"
all three VMs should be running
Python VM can make HTTP requests to JavaScript VM
Python VM can connect to Redis
each VM can access shared project directories

elements.name: Rebuild a VM after modifying its Dockerfile

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I have modified the python Dockerfile to add a new package
"python" VM is currently running
I run "start-virtual python --rebuild"
the VM should be rebuilt with the new Dockerfile
the VM should be running after rebuild
the new package should be available in the VM

elements.name: Remove VM I no longer need

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I have an old "ruby" VM I don't use anymore
I run the removal process for "ruby"
the docker-compose.yml should be preserved for easy recreation
SSH config entry should be removed
known_hosts entries should be cleaned up
the projects/ruby directory should be preserved
I can recreate it later with "start-virtual ruby"

elements.name: Add support for a new language

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
VDE doesn't support "zig" yet
I run "add-vm-type --type lang --display 'Zig' zig 'apt-get install -y zig'"
"zig" should be available as a VM type
I can create a zig VM with "create-virtual-for zig"
zig should appear in "list-vms" output

elements.name: Check what VMs I can create

steps.name: VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I want to see what development environments are available
I run "list-vms"
all language VMs should be listed with aliases
all service VMs should be listed with ports
I can see which VMs are created vs just available
VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I have several VMs configured
I run "list-vms --created"
I should see only VMs that have been created
their status (running/stopped) should be shown
I can identify which VMs to start or stop
VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
I need to test my application with a real database
I create "postgres" and "redis" service VMs
I create my language VM (e.g., "python")
I start all three VMs
my application can connect to test database
test data is isolated from development data
I can stop test VMs independently
VDE is installed on my system
Docker is running
I have SSH keys configured
a system service is using port 2200
I create a new language VM
VDE should allocate the next available port (2201)
the VM should work correctly on the new port
SSH config should reflect the correct port

name: Debugging and Troubleshooting
description: As a developer
I want tools to diagnose and fix VM issues
So that I can quickly resolve problems and continue working

steps.name: I tried to start a VM but it failed
I check the VM status
I should see a clear error message
I should know if it's a port conflict, Docker issue, or configuration problem
a VM is running but misbehaving
I run "docker logs <vm-name>"
I should see the container logs
I can identify the source of the problem
a VM is running
I run "docker exec -it <vm-name> /bin/zsh"
I should have shell access inside the container
I can investigate issues directly

elements.name: Rebuild VM from scratch after corruption

steps.name: a VM seems corrupted or misconfigured
I stop the VM
I remove the VM directory
I recreate the VM
I should get a fresh VM
old configuration issues should be resolved

elements.name: Check if port is already in use

steps.name: I get a "port already allocated" error
I check what's using the port
I should see which process is using it
I can decide to stop the conflicting process
VDE can allocate a different port
I cannot SSH into a VM
I check the SSH config
I verify the VM is running
I verify the port is correct
I can identify if the issue is SSH, Docker, or the VM itself
my application can't connect to the database
I SSH into the application VM
I try to connect to the database VM directly
I can see if the issue is network, credentials, or database state
I need to verify VM configuration
I look at the docker-compose.yml
I should see all volume mounts
I should see all port mappings
I should see environment variables
I can verify the configuration is correct
my code changes aren't reflected in the VM
I check the mounts in the container
I can see if the volume is properly mounted
I can verify the host path is correct

elements.name: Clear Docker cache to fix build issues

steps.name: a VM build keeps failing
I rebuild with --no-cache
Docker should pull fresh images
build should not use cached layers

elements.name: Reset a VM to initial state

steps.name: I've made changes I want to discard
I stop the VM
I remove the container but keep the config
I start it again
I should get a fresh container
my code volumes should be preserved
two VMs can't communicate
I check the docker network
I should see both VMs on "vde-network"
I can ping one VM from another
a VM seems slow
I run "docker stats <vm-name>"
I can see CPU and memory usage
I can identify resource bottlenecks
I think my docker-compose.yml might have errors
I run "docker-compose config"
I should see any syntax errors
the configuration should be validated
VMs won't start due to Docker problems
I check Docker is running
I restart Docker if needed
VMs should start normally after Docker is healthy

elements.name: Fix permission issues on shared volumes

steps.name: I get permission denied errors in VM
I check the UID/GID configuration
I should see if devuser (1000:1000) matches my host user
I can adjust if needed

elements.name: Diagnose why tests fail in VM but pass locally

steps.name: tests work on host but fail in VM
I compare the environments
I can check for missing dependencies
I can verify environment variables match
I can check network access from the VM

name: Docker and Container Management
description: As a developer using VDE
I want VDE to handle Docker container complexity
So I can focus on development without managing containers

steps.name: I start my first VM
VDE should create the dev-net network
all VMs should join this network
VMs should be able to communicate by name
I create multiple VMs
each VM starts
each should get a unique SSH port
ports should be auto-allocated from available range
no two VMs should have the same SSH port
I create a PostgreSQL VM
it starts
the PostgreSQL port should be mapped
I can connect to PostgreSQL from the host
other VMs can connect using the service name
I start any VM
my workspace directory should be mounted
files I create are visible on the host
changes persist across container restarts
I create a PostgreSQL VM
I stop and restart PostgreSQL
my data should be preserved
databases should remain intact
I should not lose any data
I have multiple running VMs
I check resource usage
each container should have reasonable limits
no single VM should monopolize resources
the system should remain responsive
I have running VMs
I query VM status
I should see which containers are healthy
I should see any that are failing
I should be able to identify issues
I have stopped several VMs
I start them again
old containers should be removed
new containers should be created
no stopped containers should accumulate
VDE creates a VM
a docker-compose.yml file should be generated
I can manually use docker-compose if needed
the file should follow best practices
I rebuild a language VM
the build should use multi-stage Dockerfile
final images should be smaller
build cache should be used when possible
I have dependent services
I start them together
they should start in a reasonable order
dependencies should be available when needed
the startup should complete successfully
I have multiple VMs running
one VM crashes
other VMs should continue running
the crash should not affect other containers
I can restart the crashed VM independently
I have a running VM
I need to debug an issue
I can view the container logs
logs should show container activity
I can troubleshoot problems

name: Docker Operations

I want reliable Docker Compose operations with error handling
So that VM containers start and stop correctly

steps.name: VM "python" docker-compose.yml exists
I start VM "python"
docker-compose build should be executed
image should be built successfully
VM "python" image exists
I start VM "python"
docker-compose up -d should be executed
container should be running
VM "python" is running
I stop VM "python"
docker-compose down should be executed
container should not be running
VM "python" is running
I restart VM "python"
container should be stopped
container should be started
container should have new container ID
VM "python" is running
I start VM "python" with --rebuild
docker-compose up --build should be executed
image should be rebuilt
VM "python" is running
I start VM "python" with --rebuild and --no-cache
docker-compose up --build --no-cache should be executed
all ports in range are in use
I create a new VM
error should indicate "No available ports"
VM should not be created
Docker daemon is not running
I try to start a VM
error should indicate "Cannot connect to Docker daemon"
command should fail gracefully
dev-network does not exist
I start a VM
network should be created automatically
error should indicate network issue
image does not exist locally
registry is not accessible
I start a VM
error should indicate image pull failure
container should not start
docker-compose operation fails
stderr is parsed
"port is already allocated" should map to port conflict error
"network.*not found" should map to network error
"permission denied" should map to permission error

elements.name: Retry transient failures with exponential backoff

steps.name: docker-compose operation fails with transient error
operation is retried
retry should use exponential backoff
maximum retries should not exceed 3
delay should be capped at 30 seconds
no disk space is available
I try to start a VM
error should indicate "no space left on device"
command should fail immediately
VM "python" exists
I check VM status
status should be one of: "running", "stopped", "not_created", "unknown"
multiple VMs are running
I get running VMs
all running containers should be listed
stopped containers should not be listed
VM "python" is started
docker-compose project should be "vde-python"
language VM "python" is started
container should be named "python-dev"
service VM "postgres" is started
container should be named "postgres"
VM "python" is started
projects/python volume should be mounted
logs/python volume should be mounted
volume should be mounted from host directory

elements.name: Environment variables are passed to container

steps.name: VM "python" has env file
container is started
env file should be read by docker-compose
SSH_PORT variable should be available in container

name: Error Handling and Recovery
description: As a developer using VDE
I want the system to handle errors gracefully
So I can recover quickly from problems

steps.name: I try to use a VM that doesn't exist
I request to "start nonexistent-vm"
I should receive a clear error message
the error should explain what went wrong
suggest valid VM names
a port is already in use
I try to start a VM
VDE should detect the conflict
allocate an available port
continue with the operation
Docker is not available
I try to start a VM
I should receive a helpful error
the error should explain Docker is required
suggest how to fix it
my disk is nearly full
I try to create a VM
VDE should detect the issue
warn me before starting
suggest cleaning up
the Docker network can't be created
I start a VM
VDE should report the specific error
suggest troubleshooting steps
offer to retry
a VM build fails
I examine the error
I should see what went wrong
get suggestions for fixing it
be able to retry after fixing

VDE detects the timeout
it should report the issue
show the container logs
offer to check the status
a container is running but SSH fails
I try to connect
VDE should diagnose the problem
check if SSH is running
verify the SSH port is correct
I don't have permission for an operation
VDE encounters the error
it should explain the permission issue
suggest how to fix it
offer to retry with proper permissions
a docker-compose.yml is malformed
I try to use the VM
VDE should detect the error
show the specific problem
suggest how to fix the configuration
one VM fails to start
I start multiple VMs
other VMs should continue
I should be notified of the failure
successful VMs should be listed
a transient error occurs
VDE detects it's retryable
it should automatically retry
limit the number of retries
report if all retries fail
an operation is interrupted
I try again
VDE should detect partial state
complete the operation
not duplicate work
any error occurs
the error is displayed
it should be in plain language
explain what went wrong
suggest next steps
an error occurs
VDE handles it
the error should be logged
the error should have sufficient detail for debugging
I can find it in the logs directory
an operation fails partway through
the failure is detected
VDE should clean up partial state
return to a consistent state
allow me to retry cleanly

name: Multi-Project Workflow
description: As a developer working on multiple projects
I want to switch between different development environments
So I can work on different projects without configuration conflicts

elements.name: Setting up a web development project

steps.name: I am starting a new web project
I request to "create JavaScript and nginx"
the JavaScript VM should be created
the nginx VM should be created
both should be configured for web development

elements.name: Switching from web to backend project

steps.name: I have web containers running (JavaScript, nginx)
I request to "stop all and start python and postgres"
the web containers should be stopped
the Python VM should start
the PostgreSQL VM should start
only the backend stack should be running

elements.name: New Project Setup - Start Development Stack

steps.name: I have created my VMs
I request to "start python and postgres"
both VMs should start
they should be able to communicate
I am building a microservices application
I request to "create Go, Rust, and nginx"
the Go VM should be created for one service
the Rust VM should be created for another service
the nginx VM should be created as a gateway
I have created my microservice VMs
I request to "start all services"
all service VMs should start
they should be able to communicate on the Docker network
each should have its own SSH port
I am doing data analysis
I request to "start python and r"
the Python VM should start

name: Port Management
description: As a developer
I want VDE to automatically allocate and manage SSH ports
So that VMs don't have port conflicts and can be accessed via SSH

elements.name: Allocate first available port for language VM

steps.name: no language VMs are created
I create a language VM
the VM should be allocated port "2200"

elements.name: Allocate sequential ports for multiple language VMs

steps.name: language VM "python" is allocated port "2200"
I create language VM "rust"
"rust" should be allocated port "2201"

elements.name: Allocate first available port for service VM

steps.name: no service VMs are created
I create a service VM
the VM should be allocated port "2400"

elements.name: Skip allocated ports when finding next available

steps.name: ports "2200", "2201", "2203" are allocated
I create a new language VM
the VM should be allocated port "2202"

elements.name: Port registry tracks all allocated ports

steps.name: VM "python" is allocated port "2200"
VM "rust" is allocated port "2201"
I query the port registry
"python" should be mapped to port "2200"
"rust" should be mapped to port "2201"

elements.name: Port registry persists across script invocations

steps.name: VM "python" is allocated port "2200"
I reload the VM types cache
"python" should still be mapped to port "2200"

elements.name: Detect host port collision during allocation

steps.name: a non-VDE process is listening on port "2200"
I create a new language VM
the VM should NOT be allocated port "2200"
the VM should be allocated a different available port

elements.name: Detect Docker port collision during allocation

steps.name: a Docker container is bound to host port "2201"
I create a new language VM
the VM should NOT be allocated port "2201"

elements.name: Atomic port reservation prevents race conditions

steps.name: two processes try to allocate ports simultaneously
both processes request the next available port
each process should receive a unique port
no port should be allocated twice
language ports range from "2200" to "2299"
service ports range from "2400" to "2499"
I create a language VM
the allocated port should be between "2200" and "2299"
I create a service VM
the allocated port should be between "2400" and "2499"

elements.name: Error when all ports in range are allocated

steps.name: all ports from "2200" to "2299" are allocated
I create a new language VM
the command should fail with error "No available ports"
a port lock is older than "300" seconds
I run port cleanup
the stale lock should be removed
the port should be available for allocation

elements.name: Port registry updates when VM is removed

steps.name: VM "python" is allocated port "2200"
I remove VM "python"
port "2200" should be removed from registry
port "2200" should be available for new VMs

detect_ssh_keys runs

name: Team Collaboration and Maintenance
description: As a developer in a team environment
I want to maintain and share development environments
So my team can work consistently across different machines

steps.name: I have updated my system Docker
I request to "rebuild python with no cache"
the Python container should be rebuilt from scratch
no cached layers should be used
the rebuild should use the latest base images
a VM is not working correctly
I request to "restart postgres with rebuild"
the PostgreSQL VM should be completely rebuilt
my data should be preserved (if using volumes)
the VM should start with a fresh configuration
I am experiencing issues
I request to "show status of all VMs"
I should see which VMs are running
I should see which VMs are stopped
I should see any error conditions

they should receive clear connection instructions
the instructions should include SSH config examples
the instructions should work on their first try
I need to manage multiple VMs
I request to "start python, go, and rust"
all three VMs should start in parallel
the operation should complete faster than sequential starts
all VMs should be running when complete
I have both development and service VMs running
I request to "stop all languages"
only language VMs should stop
service VMs should continue running
databases and caches should remain available
I need to update VDE itself
I stop all VMs
I can update the VDE scripts
I can rebuild all VMs with the new configuration
my workspace data should persist
a VM has crashed
I request to "restart the VM"
the VM should be stopped if running
the VM should be started again
the restart should attempt to recover the state
I want to check VM resource consumption
I query VM status
I should see which VMs are consuming resources
I should be able to identify heavy VMs
I can make decisions about which VMs to stop
my project has grown
I request to "start all services for the project"
all required VMs should start
the system should handle many VMs
each VM should have adequate resources

name: VM Lifecycle Management

So I can create, configure, start, stop, and destroy VMs as needed

the Docker image should be built

the container should be stopped if running
the configuration files should be deleted
I have modified the Dockerfile
I request to "rebuild go with no cache"
the Go VM should be rebuilt from scratch
no cached layers should be used
the new image should reflect my changes
I want to update the base image
I rebuild the VM
the latest base image should be used
my configuration should be preserved
my workspace should still be accessible

name: VM State Awareness
description: As a developer using VDE
I want the system to be aware of VM states
So I don't accidentally duplicate operations or cause conflicts

steps.name: I have a Python VM that is already running
I request to "start python"
I should be notified that Python is already running
the system should not start a duplicate container
the existing container should remain unaffected
I have a stopped VM

I should be notified that PostgreSQL is not running
no error should occur
the VM should remain stopped
I already have a Go VM configured
I request to "create a Go VM"
I should be notified that Go already exists
the system should not overwrite the existing configuration
I should be asked if I want to reconfigure it

start the Rust VM
I should be informed that it was started
I have some running and some stopped VMs
I request "status"
I should see which VMs are running
I should see which VMs are stopped
the states should be clearly distinguished

notify me of the existing VM
suggest using the existing one

I should see container uptime
I should see the image version
I should see the last start time

the result should be the same
